title: 109_s3584
content: The "Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006" requires mandatory training programs for supervisors. The "Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006" mandates training programs for supervisors, defining the term 'supervisor' and outlining operating standards for the program. The "Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006" requires interactive instructor-based training programs for supervisors on various aspects of their roles, including goal-setting, performance management, mentoring, and addressing unacceptable performance. Additionally, supervisors must receive training on prohibited personnel practices. The "Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006" mandates training for supervisors on prohibited personnel practices, mentorship for new supervisors, and completion of training programs within one year of appointment. The "Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006" requires supervisors to complete training programs every 3 years, with credit given for previous similar training. The Office of Personnel Management will prescribe regulations for agency compliance. Regulations must be in place within 180 days of the Act's enactment. The amendments made by the "Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006" will take effect 180 days after enactment. They apply to individuals appointed as supervisors and those already in the position on the effective date. All supervisors must complete training programs established under the Act. The "Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006" requires completion of training programs established under the Act within 3 years of enactment and every 3 years thereafter. SEC. 3. MANAGEMENT COMPETENCY STANDARDS. Chapter 43 of title 5, United States Code is amended to include new management competency standards for supervisors. The Office of Personnel Management will provide guidance to agencies on these standards, and each agency must develop performance assessment standards for supervisors. The Office of Personnel Management will provide guidance on new management competency standards for supervisors. Agencies must assess supervisor capacity and implement training programs to address identified issues. Agencies are required to submit progress reports annually to the Office of Personnel Management. Section 43 of title 5, United States Code, is amended by updating the item related to section 4305. Section 4305 of title 5, United States Code is updated to reference section 4306 for management competency standards and regulations.
